bibl.title: [Letter] 1820 Oct. 15, Nashville, Tennessee [to] James Winchester, Cairo, Tennessee / John Overton
bibl.author: Overton, John
bibl.note: This is a letter dated October 15, 1820 from John Overton in Nashville, Tennessee to James Winchester in Cairo, Tennessee. The content of the letter concerns travel arrangements, supplies needed, and departure details for Overton and Winchester.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p:
Your favor of the 9th I recd this day__ M Lemon has appointed the 20th of nov for all his deputy locations to meet him at Reynoldsburg, where their deputies will remain several days__ He supposes all the week or until Satruday the 26th of nov__ Before I knew of your departure to cross Ten__ at Brutons ferry I had written to Mr Lawrence, one of M Lemons locations that I would meet him at Reynoldsburg when he came up there on the 20th__ He, as well as others will go from there with us and be an assistance__ Beside I have five or six thousand acres of land WB to locate, and have engaged M Lemons Co: to locate for me and wished to be there & as to distribute my WB according to their nos drawn, and according to the information I should be able to get from there departur at their time__ It would be very desirable for me to pursue this
unless you have an impermeable objection__ It is important for me & it can be done.

Will you have the tents and such things as you can conveniently bring and let me know what I must have in trading for the trip__ I would propose that you be at my home on tuesday night the 21t nov__ or meet me in Nashville
In a few days I shall send up Lewis when I expect an answer
div1.closer:
Very rsply Yours Jn OvertonGenl Winchester PS. Have you in your eye a good cryer to cry our lots at the sale in Memphis__ Very much depend on a good Cryer__ JO
As we have already incurred considerable expense in the pack horse line, I would propose to find one of my mules gratis __ you bring down a good packe saddle__
Genl James Winchester near Cairo (T) Judge Jn Overton 15th Oct 1821
